alert.note: Alert for Southeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Lake County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 13 at 9:38PM PST until December 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER WILL CONTINUE THROUGH WEDNESDAY... Snow levels will continue to drop to around 1000 feet by late tonight. However, snow showers will taper off during the evening and overnight hours. Some minor accumulations will be possible at elevations as low as 1,000 feet by Tuesday morning, which includes the highway summits through Mendocino and Lake County. Otherwise, another storm system will produce moderate to heavy snow accumulations for elevations as low 1500 to 2000 feet on Wednesday. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow above 1500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Southeastern Mendocino Interior and Southern Lake Counties. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state of California can be obtained by calling 1-800-GAS-ROAD.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern Mendocino Interior; Southern Lake County
